column2: Dark, feral beasts indigenous to Naggaroth, tempted from their damp, warm caves to bear the Druchii to battle.
True horses no longer, Dark Magic corrupts the finest Elven steeds and turns them into black-flanked killers.
The corrupted Dark Pegasi fly south from the Chaos Wastes to Naggaroth's Iron Mountains to make their nests.
Secretly nurtured by Malekith, Black Dragons are enchanted with Dark Magic that corrupts and enhances.
Should a Battle Wizard need a mount, then his station would ensure he receives a warhorse of good breed.
Should a Battle Wizard need a mount, then his station would ensure he receives a warhorse of good breed.
Battle Wizards are rarely armoured for it interferes with their casting, yet a steed can and should be barded to add a level of protection.
Battle Wizards are rarely armoured for it interferes with their casting, yet a steed can and should be barded to add a level of protection.
Imperial pegasi are found in Grey Mountains where Bretonnian and Empire hunters fight over capturing the foals.
Imperial pegasi are found in Grey Mountains where Bretonnian and Empire hunters fight over capturing the foals.
The bond between rider and steed goes beyond friendship or family; they act as one.
Its forehead adorned with a spiral horn, this noble mount carries the Spellsinger where their magical gifts are needed most.
Fly on your wings, like an eagle. Touch the sun. Track the foe, ambush, and defeat.

A griffon is a majestic beast - part lion, part eagle, and extremely deadly and terrible to behold in battle, for the foe at least.
A weapon from the College of Light, vaporising their enemies by channelling the Wind of Hysh.
Wyverns are occasionally mistaken for dragons but there is little nobility of spirit in these winged beasts, making them kindred spirits for their Orc riders.
The war boar is a stubborn and vicious animal - an extremely tough beast that is notoriously bad tempered, loudly flatulent, unpredictable, and wholly dangerous.
Wyverns are occasionally mistaken for dragons but there is little nobility of spirit in these winged beasts, making them kindred spirits for their Orc riders.
The war boar is a stubborn and vicious animal - an extremely tough beast that is notoriously bad tempered, loudly flatulent, unpredictable, and wholly dangerous.

Wyverns are occasionally mistaken for dragons but there is little nobility of spirit in these winged beasts, making them kindred spirits for their Orc riders.
As a Slayer continues to carve a massive toll of beast upon his axe, they often take the names of the beast they slay. Such names includes becoming a Trollslayer, or a Giantslayer.
Whether by their sheer martial skills, toughness or determination, these Dwarfs, though unsuccesful in their quest, have inadvertently been molded into a magnificent warriors.
Daemon Slayer, a warrior who has managed to survive the encounter with one of the most ferocious creatures to ever live, slaying it and surviving to tell the tale.

When called to war, the Doombull's reach into the piles of weapons and armour heaped in offering before the herdstones, equipping themselves with the largest and most formidable weapons they can find.
A Doombull, with axes in hand, can hold its own against dozens of enemies with vicious, brutal fury.
The bond between rider and steed goes beyond friendship or family; they act as one.
Its forehead adorned with a spiral horn, this noble mount carries the darksinger where their magical gifts are needed most.
Fly on your wings, like an eagle. Touch the sun. Track the foe, ambush, and defeat.
The bond between rider and steed goes beyond friendship or family; they act as one.
Its forehead adorned with a spiral horn, this noble mount carries the highsinger where their magical gifts are needed most.
Fly on your wings, like an eagle. Touch the sun. Track the foe, ambush, and defeat.
The steeds of the Midnight Aristocracy are unnatural destriers called Nightmares. They are Undead stallions clad in baroque barding.
Hellsteeds are the unholy fusion of horse and giant bat, bound by Dark Magic - a fitting steed for a Vampire noble.
Animated by Dark Magic, a zombie dragon is an unholy parody of a once-noble beast now borne aloft by great tattered wings, its body covered with thick, withered hide.

A true lord or lady of undeath refuses to churn through the mud of a battlefield like a common peasant or be content with the dubious dignity of sitting astride a grave-beast. Instead, the monarchs of the night are often borne to war on gilded palanquins known as Coven Thrones.

The horses of Norsca live for battle, even choosing to graze on the bones of the fallen over grass.
Marauder mobs are awarded even greater mobility when riding their crude chariots of bone and wood, lashed together with the guts and sinew of the vanquished.
Manticores are huge leonine beasts with the wings of a giant bat and tails the drip with poison. They are the fiercest of all Chaotic mounts.
This vicious beast carries a warshrine aloft, carrying blasphemous icons and unholy relics to battle in sight of the Chaos Gods.
